data.title: Test: Master-detail SCM
data.body:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/33363

- [x] Windows - @chrmarti 
- [x] Linux - @bpasero 
- [x] macOS - @jrieken

Complexity: 4

The SCM viewlet has changed how it behaves wrt multiple scm _repositories_:

- When a single repository is open, everything should work as before
- When multiple repositories are open, one should be visible by default
  - You can multi-select in the list to have multiple splitviews in the scm viewlet
  - Make sure actions work
  - Make sure interactions make sense
- Make sure other features around SCM are unbroken

data.title: Test improved completion/signature help api
data.body:
Test for: #11877 and #752
Complexity: 2

- [x] Any OS - @dbaeumer 

We have added API to allow formatted content to be returned for completion items and for signature help. Make sure it does what you want, that the doc is clear and that it works consistently. 

We have also added a `CompletionContext` that provided more information about why completions were requested. Also make sure it does what you want, that the doc is clear and that it works consistently.

data.title: Pass locale to Initialize request
data.body:
With https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/129 the debug adapter protocol now supports to send the "locale" to the debug adapter.

With this VS Code now needs to pass this info in the Initialize request.

Files that I've been using for weeks without any errors showing are now flagging my components with an error in lines like `import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core';` 2. not sure what's different. Same project, using Code's version of TS. Could be user error, but I have no idea why and haven't changed anything, other than updating each Insiders build.

data.title: Wired Behaviour of TypeScript Build Task
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.16.1
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a folder with a tsconfig as follows
```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "es5",                          /* Specify ECMAScript target version: 'ES3' (default), 'ES5', 'ES2015', 'ES2016', 'ES2017', or 'ESNEXT'. */
    "module": "commonjs",                     /* Specify module code generation: 'none', commonjs', 'amd', 'system', 'umd', 'es2015', or 'ESNext'. */
     "outDir": "./lib",                        /* Redirect output structure to the directory. */
  }
}
```
2.
open that project in vscode
3. create build task for typescript
(will result in)
```
{
    // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
    // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "version": "2.0.0",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "type": "typescript",
            "tsconfig": "tsconfig.json",
            "group": {
                "kind": "build",
                "isDefault": true
            }
        }
    ]
}
```
will result in 

```
> Executing task: tsc  -p "/Users/dietrich/typescript/tutorial/tsconfig.json" <

error TS5014: Failed to parse file '/Users/dietrich/typescript/tutorial/tsconfig.json/tsconfig.json': Unexpected token u in JSON at position 0.
The terminal process terminated with exit code: 1

Terminal will be reused by tasks, press any key to close it.
```



<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

The very same project works with a "local" typescript dependency (e.g. via package.json)

data.title: Suggestion: Allow disabling autoClosingBrackets within strings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Latest
- OS Version: Windows 10 & Linux Mint

Idea:

Currently if you have `autoClosingBrackets` enabled auto closing tags inside strings still auto complete so if I'm typing inside a single or double quote string it'll still attempt to auto close quotations withing the string same with braces, it would be nice to be able to disable auto closing brackets for strings all together or even disable single/double quotes within strings.

That or improve auto-closing quotations within strings because it malforms the strings all together every time I use them.

data.title: Disabled install action in extension viewlet/editor has hover feedback
data.body: When an extension is installing, its `Install action` is disabled and labelled `Installing..`. Yet, hovering with the mouse still shows hover feedback.

data.title: Test: Multi root adoption for tasks
Bad contribution registration
data.body:
from slack: 

>my commits added one more file which likely changes the order in which files get loaded. The underlying issue is that `EditorExtensions.Editors` is defined in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/common/editor.ts#L37 while the actual registration of that extension/registry happens in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/browser/parts/editor/baseEditor.ts#L305. Now, consumers of the editor-contribution-point make a false dependency because loading `editor.ts` doesn’t cause `baseEditor.ts` to be loaded. @bpasero please adjust the file dependencies (definition of the constant and the extension point) such that the dependencies are correct.

data.body:

- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
html-snippets|abu|0.1.0
htmltagwrap|bra|0.0.3
npm-intellisense|chr|1.3.0
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
danielo-node-snippets|dan|1.0.3
markdown-table-prettify|dar|1.1.1
vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.2
githistory|don|0.2.3
gitlens|eam|5.2.0
EditorConfig|Edi|0.10.1
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.1
auto-close-tag|for|0.5.0
auto-complete-tag|for|0.0.2
auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14
vue-snippets|hol|0.1.5
JSDocTagComplete|Hoo|0.0.2
badges|idl|1.0.7
sublime-babel-vscode|jos|0.2.9
vscode-github|Kni|0.19.0
vue|liu|0.1.5
lit-it|moh|1.2.12
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.3.0
vetur|oct|0.9.10
vuehelper|oys|0.1.0
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.18
material-icon-theme|PKi|2.2.1
vscode-icons|rob|7.13.0
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.3
code-spell-checker|str|1.4.0
vscode-react-redux-snippets|tha|0.3.3
quokka-vscode|Wal|1.0.66
ReactSnippets|xab|1.4.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try to debug a program that has underscore as first parameter. Something like this
```js
{
            "name": "Run mocha",
            "request": "launch",
            "type": "node",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}\\node_modules\\.bin\\_mocha",
            // Automatically stop program after launch.
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            // Command line arguments passed to the program.
            "args": [
                "-b",
                "--recursive",
                "build/test/"
            ],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            // Workspace relative or absolute path to the runtime executable to be used. Default is the runtime executable on the PATH.
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            // Environment variables passed to the program.
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "test"
            }
        }
```
2. See how the pat becomes `node_modules/.bin_mocha` instead of `node_modules/.bin/_mocha`

data.title: VSC freezes when opening .js or .ts files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:23.027Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.2
tslint|eg2|1.0.9
vscode-auto-open-markdown-preview|hnw|0.0.4
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.3.0
seti-icons|qin|0.1.3

> The extensions above are disabled

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start VSC editor (using last opened project folder)
2. Select a `.js` file
3. Editor window freezes
4. After waiting some time, you get the option REOPEN, KEEP WAITING, CLOSE
5. KEEP WAITING, jumps to previos step 4
6. REOPEN, you end up at step 1.
7. Same thing for `.ts` files.
8. No problem for `.json`, `.svg` files.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Other things I did:
A couple of days ago I installed Nodejs 8.5.0  
I uninstalled VSC and re-installed the latest version  
Still same problems  
I uninstalled Nodejs 8.5.0 and reinstalle Nodejs LTS 6.11.3
Still same problems

data.title: Test: console shows origin when used from extensions
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/34936

- [ ] Windows 
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] macOS

Complexity: 2

When using `console.log`, `console.warn` or `console.error` from an extension, the log information is serialised from the extension host to the renderer and then played back in the renderers DevTools console as well as debug console. This means that the origin of the console use from the extension is lost. We now preserve the origin and allow access to it.

Use `console.log`, `console.warn` or `console.error` from your extension with strings, objects, primitives etc. Verify:
* you can expand the message in the extension host dev tools to see the full stack of where the message was sent
* you see the location of the message in the right hand side of the debug console and can click on it
* the data that you log is not shown up in a bad way or is lost

data.title: Remove TimerService debt
data.body:
The current timer service depends on outsiders assigning values to its public files, like `restoreViewletDuration`. These things should be replaced with `startupTimers` as it encapsulates/hides information properly and as it makes it easier to add new timer ticks. 

This is a [sample](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/extensions/electron-browser/extensionService.ts#L322) using startup timers, this is how the timer service [uses](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/timer/node/timerService.ts#L97) the ticks

data.title: Language specific encoding is not used right on startup
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. let an extension configure a custom encoding for its language, e.g. for markdown via [`package.json`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/markdown/package.json#L277):
```json
"configurationDefaults": {
	"[markdown]": {
		"editor.wordWrap": "on",
		"editor.quickSuggestions": false,
		"files.encoding": "utf16be"
	}
}
```
2. open a markdown file (it should show up as garbage)
3. reload window

=> file is back to UTF-8
=> the encoding configuration is only resolved later after the file has already loaded

Suggest fix is to store the encoding information of the file into storage and restore it after restart from there.

data.title: Remove AsyncDescriptor usages
data.body: As we don't lazy load anything anymore we shouldn't use the `AsyncDescriptor` anymore and consider it debt. Its removal is blocked by some workbench components still depending on it.

Fixes #34863

**Bug**
Quick suggestions currently check the token at the cursor location to determine if we are in a string or comment. Because token spans are setup like: `[start, end)`, this results in the incorrect token being checked when the quick suggestions are triggered immediatly before a comment or string

**Fix**
Check the token one index back from the cursor

* Ensure ripgrep is killed when vscode exits, for #34434

* touch bar: reuse groups

* Fix wrong path join in queryBuilder.ts

* better fix for #34796

* :lipstick:

* Fixes #34826: write character before cursor to the textarea on OSX to allow the "long-press" composition to work

* Fix #34834

* handle missing product.commit, #34523

* mark `commit` as optional, #34523

* show console.log from extension host top frame in dev tools (#34936)

* remove profiling hint as it isn't reliable/valuable enough

* Fix #33670

data.title: VSCode very laggy and dependent on window size

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:16:27.618Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 3.10.0-514.6.1.el7.x86_64
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
bracket-pair-colorizer|Coe|0.10.9
vscode-eclipse-keybindings|alp|0.9.6
Doxygen|bbe|1.0.0
cpptools|ms-|0.12.4
funclist|qrt|7.0.0

(1 theme extensions excluded)

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any file, maximise window to fill desktop.
2. Feel keyboard lag and slowly increase frustration levels ;)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Basically, if I have the vscode window open in full screen the gui response lag for vscode is really quite bad. If I make the window smaller the lag time is reduced, and if the window is postage stamp sized the lag is useable.

Please ask for any specific info you may need to help resolve this issue.

data.title: September Endgame
data.body:
## Endgame Schedule
- *September 25*, Code freeze for the endgame
- *October 1*, Endgame done

#### Monday, September 25
- [x] Code freeze at 5pm PT
- [x] Ensure we have a green build on all platforms at 5pm PT
- [x] All test items are created (with "complexity" but not necessarily with full description) by 11pm ZRH time (2pm PT)
- [x] All test items contain comprehensive test descriptions by 10pm PT
- Testers who cannot participate in testing check-off from list below:

#### Wednesday, September 27

- [x] Testing
- [x] [Fixing](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A%22September+2017%22+label%3Abug) (self-assigned, milestone assigned)

#### Thursday, September 28
- [x] [Fixing last issues](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A%22September+2017%22+label%3Abug)
- [x] [Verification needed](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+label%3Averification-needed)
- [x] [Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+-label%3Aas-designed+milestone%3A%22September+2017%22)
- [x] Run [OSS tool](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-distro/blob/master/distro-tools/README.md) after merging shrink-wrap findings **endgame master**
  - *The LCA review of the ThirdPartyNotices.txt files is not needed anymore*
  - do not forget to update the `distro` attribute in the package.json with the commit ID of the distro repo.
- [x] Check new OSS usage is entered into the [OSS registry](https://ossmsft.visualstudio.com/_apps/hub/ms.vss-oss-web.hub-oss) **endgame master**

#### Friday, September 29
- Satellite modules/npm packages ready, version updated, smoke tested

- When done fixing/verifying and there are changes since last build at the end of day PT
  - [ ] Trigger new insider build and publish it manually **@owner**

##### Friday/Monday
- [x] Disable continuous `insider` builds - **endgame master**
- [x] Branch code to `release/<x.y>` and release `master` - **endgame master**

data.title: Hook extension console into debug console
data.body: Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/34936

data.title: Need a flag to know if an extension is adopted to MR workspace or not
data.body:
We would need this flag to know if we could copy those settings contributed by an extension while transitioning from a Folder window to Workspace window.

More details here - https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/33670

data.title: Extensions: show location of console log in consoles
data.body:
When using console.log from an extension we loose the location where the console.log was triggered from. We should capture the location and show it:
* in our debug console
* in dev tools

data.title: Full screen / Zen mode window flickering

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:26:20.018Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-35-generic (Ubuntu Gnome 16.04)
- Using touchpad mouse in X1 Carbon laptop
- Extensions: (disabled)

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
crane|Hvy|0.3.8
php-namespace-resolver|Meh|0.7.6
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.18
vscode-intelephense-client|bme|0.7.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.2
vscode-instant-markdown|dba|1.3.0
drupal-8-snippets|dss|0.0.1
php-debug|fel|1.11.1
php-intellisense|fel|1.5.1
rest-client|hum|0.15.2
drupal-7-snippets|jun|0.0.7
Go|luk|0.6.65
VS-code-drupal|mar|0.0.12
drupal7-hooks-snippets|pau|0.0.2

While in Full screen mode or Zen mode, the window disappear/flickers for couple milliseconds (making other background windows visible) 3-6 times per minute. Especially when scrolling or moving the mouse.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch the IDE without extensions
2. Open some files
3. Go to Full screen mode or Zen mode
4. Scroll and browse files from sidebar
5. Scroll opened files

Unxpected result: The code's window disappears for very short time (1-10ms) when having mouse activity.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes
